sen.j: 神明山古墳（しんめいやまこふん）は、京都府京丹後市に所在する古墳時代前期後半の前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Located in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound made in the latter half of the early kofun (tumulus) period.
Located in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound made in the latter half of the early kofun (tumulus) period.
Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound made in the latter half of the early kofun (tumulus) period, located in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: この巨大古墳は4世紀後半に築造され、墳丘長190メートルあり、海とのかかわりのある豪族の墓と推定されていた。
sen.e: It was presumed that this huge tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the fourth century and that, with its length of 190 m, was the tomb of the head of a local ruling family concerned with the sea..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was presumed that this huge tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the fourth century and that, with its length of 190 m, was the tomb of the head of a local ruling family concerned with the sea..

It was presumed that this huge tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the fourth century and that, with its length of 190 m, was the tomb of the head of a local ruling family concerned with the sea.
sen.cmt: 余分なピリオドをのぞきました。

sen.j: しかし、その後に、古墳の北西に竹野湖があり、潟湖のほとりにあり、砂丘で海と隔たっていることが指摘された。
sen.e: However, later it was pointed out that, with Lake Takeno in the north-west of the tumulus, the tumulus was beside a lagoon and was separated from the sea with sand dunes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, later it was pointed out that, with Lake Takeno in the north-west of the tumulus, the tumulus was beside a lagoon and was separated from the sea by sand dunes.
However, later it was pointed out that, with Lake Takeno in the north-west of the tumulus, the tumulus was beside a lagoon and was separated from the sea by sand dunes.

sen.j: 海岸線と平行に築造されていて、葺石を貼っているから海上から眺めると白色に輝いてよく目立ち、港の位置を示す標識にもなった。
sen.e: Built in parallel with a coastline and covered with ki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb), it shone white and could be viewed clearly from the sea, constituting a sign indicating a port location.
Built in parallel with a coastline and covered with ki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb), it shone white and could be viewed clearly from the sea, constituting a sign indicating a port location.
Built in parallel with a coastline and covered with fuki-ishi (a stone covering an old tomb), it shone white and could be viewed clearly from the sea, constituting a sign indicating a port location.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 4世紀の後半以降、港との関係で大規模な前方後円墳が現れた。
sen.e: After the latter half of the fourth century, large-scale keyhole-shaped tumuli appeared in relation with ports.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the latter half of the fourth century, large-scale keyhole-shaped tumuli appeared in relation with ports.
After the latter half of the fourth century, large-scale keyhole-shaped tumuli appeared in relation with ports.

sen.j: 上総、尾張、丹後、伯耆などでは、その地域最大の古墳も港との関係で出現した。
sen.e: For examples, in Kazusa Province, Owari Province, Tango Province and Hoki Province, the largest tumulus in each of these provinces appeared in relation with the sea as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For examples, in Kazusa Province, Owari Province, Tango Province and Hoki Province, the largest tumulus in each of these provinces appeared in relation to the sea as well.
For examples, in Kazusa Province, Owari Province, Tango Province and Hoki Province, and so on, the largest tumulus in each of these provinces appeared in relation to the sea as well.

sen.j: このようなことから、丹後王国（丹後政権）論が提出されている。
sen.e: From these facts, a theory insisting that a Tango kingdom (Tango government) existed has been presented.
From these facts, a theory insisting that a Tango kingdom (Tango government) existed has been presented.
From these facts, a theory insisting that a Tango kingdom (Tango government) existed has been presented.

sen.j: 船を漕ぐ人をへら描きにした埴輪が出土している。
sen.e: A haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs (kofun)) on which a person rowing a ship is drawn with a spatula was unearthed.
A haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs - kofun) on which a person rowing a ship is drawn with a spatula was unearthed.
A haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs - kofun) on which a person rowing a ship is drawn with a spatula was unearthed.
